Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Package remained verified after the organization owning the namespace was removed as owner of the package" (#6039) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
See PR: https://github.com/NuGet/NuGetGallery/pull/5984

The package is still verified after the organization owning the namespace was removed as the owner of the package. 
Observation: Everything in database seems to be cleaned.
1. The package has only one owner that is not the org or the org admin.

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "HTTP 500 error when verifying a new account" (#5889) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
We're converting our company username/password account into an organization. Here's what happened leading up to the HTTP 500 error

- In Chrome, I logged into our company nuget account (with a username/password)
- In Firefox, I created a new account for myself using my Microsoft account
- I received the email asking me to verify my account
- I clicked the verify link which launched Chrome (where I was already logged in but to a different account)

At this point, I received the error:

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "Statistics: monitor number of downloads processed per day" (#6070) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
If there is a massive drop in downloads processed, it may indicate there is something faulty in our statistics pipeline.

See https://github.com/NuGet/NuGetGallery/issues/6051

LINQ query:
```
var minDate = Fact_Downloads.Max(d => d.Dimension_Date_Id) - 30;
Fact_Downloads.Where(d => d.Dimension_Date_Id >= minDate).GroupBy(d => d.Dimension_Date_Id).Select(g => new { Date = g.Key, DownloadCount = g.Sum(d => d.DownloadCount) }).Dump();
```

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "Download count for package decreased between updates" (#6069) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
See https://github.com/NuGet/NuGetGallery/issues/6051

Download counts for `ical.net` (@rianjs) went from 228927 on 6/13 to 228832 on 6/14.

It's not clear whether or not this indicates we've lost data in the statistics DB or if a bug in the job that updates the Gallery DB with the latest download counts has an issue where it is incorrectly aggregating the results.

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Register certificates should not require 2FA for AAD based accounts." (#6005) at NuGet/NuGetGallery

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "[Test Failure][Localization][FRA][RUS] PM UI can’t be opened successfully" (#7021) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
## Details about Problem
NuGet version : NuGet Client release-4.8.0-preview3-4.8.0.5266
VS version : D15.8 27811.00
OS version : Windows 10 16299.RS3_Release_svc_escrow.180502-1908.

Worked before? If so, with which NuGet version:
NuGet Client Dev 4.8.0.5234

## Detailed repro steps so we can see the same problem
1.Create a C#->Windows Desktop ->Class Library (.NET Framework) project.
2.Right click the project and open ‘Manage NuGet Packages’.

## Expected: 
‘Manage NuGet Packages’ should be opened successfully.
 
## Actual: 
‘Manage NuGet Packages’ can’t be opened successfully as below screenshot.
![123](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/40230425/41340759-a3e456fe-6ee7-11e8-8dbe-78f48bef95ed.png)

## Error Message:

Microsoft Visual Studio

La propriété Set 'System.Windows.Controls.ColumnDefinition.Width' a levé une exception.

OK   

## Notes:
1. The issue only repro FRA and RUS.
2. The issue can repro on other templates.
3. PMC can be opened successfully.

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "dotnet restore failure, nuget restore success with same configuration behind proxy" (#7032) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
_From @Flern on June 14, 2018 23:22_

## Steps to reproduce
Get behind a proxy that requires user/password authentication.
Set up a docker container for builds, using the following during setup with nuget.exe:
```
## Run NuGet setup		  
echo "Configuring NuGet ...";
Start-Process -FilePath "$installPath\nuget.exe"
              -ArgumentList 'config',
			  '-set', 'http_proxy=http://proxy.server.com:8080', 
			  '-set', 'http_proxy.user=user',
			  '-set', 'http_proxy.password=abuser*' -NoNewWindow -Wait
```

Confirm encoded NuGet.config at %appdata%\Nuget\Nuget.config:

```
> type %appdata%\Nuget\NuGet.config
?<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<configuration>
  <packageSources>
    <add key="nuget.org" value="https://api.nuget.org/v3/index.json" protocolVersion="3" />
  </packageSources>
  <config>
    <add key="http_proxy" value="http://proxy.server.com:8080" />
    <add key="http_proxy.user" value="user" />
    <add key="http_proxy.password" 
value="" />
  </config>
</configuration>
```

Run dotnet restore from solution folder.
## Expected  behavior
Packages restore.

## Actual behavior
Restore fails:
```
  Restoring packages for C:\builds\buildName\SolutionDir\Target.Tests\Target.Tests.csproj...
C:\Program Files\dotnet\sdk\2.1.300\NuGet.targets(114,5): error : Unable to load the service index for source https://api.nuget.org/v3/index.json. [C:\builds\buildName\SolutionDir\SolutionFile.sln]
C:\Program Files\dotnet\sdk\2.1.300\NuGet.targets(114,5): error :   Response status code does not indicate success: 407 (Proxy Authentication Required). [C:\builds\buildName\SolutionDir\SolutionFile.sln]
```

Nuget restore successfully uses the proxy settings and restores the packages.

## Environment data
`dotnet --info` output:

```
C:\builds>dotnet --info
.NET Core SDK (reflecting any global.json):
 Version:   2.1.300
 Commit:    adab45bf0c

Runtime Environment:
 OS Name:     Windows
 OS Version:  10.0.14393
 OS Platform: Windows
 RID:         win10-x64
 Base Path:   C:\Program Files\dotnet\sdk\2.1.300\

Host (useful for support):
  Version: 2.1.0
  Commit:  caa7b7e2ba

.NET Core SDKs installed:
  2.1.201 [C:\Program Files\dotnet\sdk]
  2.1.300 [C:\Program Files\dotnet\sdk]

.NET Core runtimes installed:
  Microsoft.AspNetCore.All 2.1.0 [C:\Program Files\dotnet\shared\Microsoft.AspNetCore.All]
  Microsoft.AspNetCore.App 2.1.0 [C:\Program Files\dotnet\shared\Microsoft.AspNetCore.App]
  Microsoft.NETCore.App 2.0.7 [C:\Program Files\dotnet\shared\Microsoft.NETCore.App]
  Microsoft.NETCore.App 2.1.0 [C:\Program Files\dotnet\shared\Microsoft.NETCore.App]

To install additional .NET Core runtimes or SDKs:
  https://aka.ms/dotnet-download

C:\builds>
```

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "`Update-Package [packagename] -reinstall` reinstalls all packages instead of just the named one" (#737) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:

Repro:

```
git clone --recursive  https://mseng.visualstudio.com/defaultcollection/VSIDEProj/_git/VSIDEProj.MEF MEF
cd MEF
git checkout f7f2810554bd
nuget restore src
src\Microsoft.VisualStudio.Composition.sln
```

```
update-package nerdbank.gitversioning -reinstall
```

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "dotnet restore failure, nuget restore success with same configuration behind proxy" (#7032) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
_From @Flern on June 14, 2018 23:22_

## Steps to reproduce
Get behind a proxy that requires user/password authentication.
Set up a docker container for builds, using the following during setup with nuget.exe:
```
## Run NuGet setup		  
echo "Configuring NuGet ...";
Start-Process -FilePath "$installPath\nuget.exe"
              -ArgumentList 'config',
			  '-set', 'http_proxy=http://proxy.server.com:8080', 
			  '-set', 'http_proxy.user=user',
			  '-set', 'http_proxy.password=abuser*' -NoNewWindow -Wait
```

Confirm encoded NuGet.config at %appdata%\Nuget\Nuget.config:

```
> type %appdata%\Nuget\NuGet.config
?<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<configuration>
  <packageSources>
    <add key="nuget.org" value="https://api.nuget.org/v3/index.json" protocolVersion="3" />
  </packageSources>
  <config>
    <add key="http_proxy" value="http://proxy.server.com:8080" />
    <add key="http_proxy.user" value="user" />
    <add key="http_proxy.password" 
value="" />
  </config>
</configuration>
```

Run dotnet restore from solution folder.
## Expected  behavior
Packages restore.

## Actual behavior
Restore fails:
```
  Restoring packages for C:\builds\buildName\SolutionDir\Target.Tests\Target.Tests.csproj...
C:\Program Files\dotnet\sdk\2.1.300\NuGet.targets(114,5): error : Unable to load the service index for source https://api.nuget.org/v3/index.json. [C:\builds\buildName\SolutionDir\SolutionFile.sln]
C:\Program Files\dotnet\sdk\2.1.300\NuGet.targets(114,5): error :   Response status code does not indicate success: 407 (Proxy Authentication Required). [C:\builds\buildName\SolutionDir\SolutionFile.sln]
```

Nuget restore successfully uses the proxy settings and restores the packages.

## Environment data
`dotnet --info` output:

```
C:\builds>dotnet --info
.NET Core SDK (reflecting any global.json):
 Version:   2.1.300
 Commit:    adab45bf0c

Runtime Environment:
 OS Name:     Windows
 OS Version:  10.0.14393
 OS Platform: Windows
 RID:         win10-x64
 Base Path:   C:\Program Files\dotnet\sdk\2.1.300\

Host (useful for support):
  Version: 2.1.0
  Commit:  caa7b7e2ba

.NET Core SDKs installed:
  2.1.201 [C:\Program Files\dotnet\sdk]
  2.1.300 [C:\Program Files\dotnet\sdk]

.NET Core runtimes installed:
  Microsoft.AspNetCore.All 2.1.0 [C:\Program Files\dotnet\shared\Microsoft.AspNetCore.All]
  Microsoft.AspNetCore.App 2.1.0 [C:\Program Files\dotnet\shared\Microsoft.AspNetCore.App]
  Microsoft.NETCore.App 2.0.7 [C:\Program Files\dotnet\shared\Microsoft.NETCore.App]
  Microsoft.NETCore.App 2.1.0 [C:\Program Files\dotnet\shared\Microsoft.NETCore.App]

To install additional .NET Core runtimes or SDKs:
  https://aka.ms/dotnet-download

C:\builds>
```

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "NuGet.org API rate limits for package updates" (#24) at NuGet/Announcements
Events.RelatedBody:
|Spec wiki|Discussion issue|
|----------|------------------|
|*None*|https://github.com/NuGet/NuGetGallery/issues/4679|

We have been working on improving the package submission workflow to reduce the overall time it takes to publish the package (right from package push/upload) till it's available for consumption and search. 

As mentioned on our [blog post](https://blog.nuget.org/20180201/NuGet-package-publishing-workflow-behind-the-scenes.html), the package availability gets degraded multi fold whenever there is a large number package uploads/updates by a single owner that clogs the package submission pipeline. Until we are able to scale to handle the large submission rate, in the short-term, we plan to reduce the rate limits for package pushes or deletes (unlist) per user.

The current [documented rate limits](https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/nuget/api/rate-limits#package-push-and-unlist) will be updated to the following new limits once implemented. This change will go live, **soon** (within a week or two):

## Package Push and Unlist

| API | Limit Type | Limit Value | API usecase | 
|:---|:---|:---|:--- |
**PUT** `/api/v2/package` | API Key | ~~100 / minute~~ **250 / hour** | Upload a new NuGet package (version) via v2 push endpoint 
**DELETE** `/api/v2/package/{id}/{version}` | API Key | ~~100 / minute~~ **50 / hour** | Unlist a NuGet package (version) via v2 endpoint
